title: Lift Button Inserts - 3231
content:
I know it’s a really small sample but it’s all I’ve been given. Sorry. Client wants me to match the font “pretty acurately” - the “2” looks strange. I think the small radiused corners are from a bad screenprinting job rather than by design. Thanks in advance for any thoughts.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [3231.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20071205070912/http:/typophile.com/files/3231.jpg) | 11.95 KB |

 [‹ "acdsee" rounded geometric sans logo](http://web.archive.org/web/20071205070912/http:/www.typophile.com/node/17660 "Go to previous forum topic") [Serial numbers on auto assembly documents (late 1960s--1970s) ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071205070912/http:/www.typophile.com/node/17652 "Go to next forum topic")
author: x8x8x

comments.content:
[Berthold Akzidenz Grotesk Super](http://web.archive.org/web/20071205070912/http:/www.philsfonts.com/detail.html?sku=AB89001012P1) looks pretty close.

- Mike Yanega

I looked at that Mike... and yes, it’s kinda close, but the terminals on the “3” are perfectly horizontal on the saample. I suspect it’s something that someone has mangled and tortured. I was thinking that it might have been originally a condensed black of some font that has been super s-t-r-e-t-c-h-e-d (hence the weird weight differences). But thanks anyway!

I’m still looking, but [Avant Garde Gothic Bold](http://web.archive.org/web/20071205070912/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/itc-avant-garde-gothic/) has a 2 and 3 that match even better than my previous pick (not the 1 however). Strangely, the ’3’ proportions changed to be more symmetrical at that weight — something I hadn’t noticed before in Avant Garde.

- Mike Yanega

Mike,

Thanks for your help - I think I’ve convinced my client that the Akzidenz is as close as we’re going to get. No accounting for bad taste huh? Thanks for being able to pick your brain though. Have a good one!
